| First                   = Savage Sword of Conan #42

| Overview                = The '''Celts''' were the people of [[Ireland]] and the greater [[British Isles]].

They were considered a race of [[barbarians]].{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #14|; A Kull Glossary: Celt's entry}}
| History                 = 
===Origins===
They Celts were the descendants of the [[Milesians]],{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; The [[Tuatha de Danaan]]'s entry}}{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 12}} while the Milesians remained one of the Celtic tribes of [[Hibernia]] (future [[Ireland]]).{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[United Kingdom]]'s entry}}

Other accounts state that their various people have distinct origins:
* The [[Gaels (Earth-616)|Gaels]] (ancestors of the [[Irish]] and [[Highland Scotch]]) were the descendants of pure-blooded{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #17|; The Hyborian Age: The Darkness... and the Dawn}} [[Cimmerians]].{{r|Handbook of the Conan Universe #1|; [[Cimmeria]]'s entry}}<!-- by 55BC, they lived with the Scots and Milesians in Hibernia.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[United Kingdom]]'s entry}} -->
* The blond [[Gauls]] and [[Britons (Earth-616)|Britons]] (as well as the [[Achaians]]) were descended from pure-blooded [[Aesir (Nordheim)|Aesir]].{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #17|; The Hyborian Age: The Darkness... and the Dawn}}
** The Aesir that lived in [[Aesgaard]] after the [[Age of Conan]] (to be distinguished of the [[Nemedian Aesir]]) eventually were forced to flee their nation due to the encroaching glaciers. They swarmed into [[Brythunia]] and became known as [[Brythons]] or Britons.{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #30|; A Gazetteer of the Hyborian Age: [[Aesir (Nordheimr)|Aesir]]'s entry}}

===Celtic [[Antiquity]]<!-- {{r|Druid #1}}, unsure of the scope -->===
====Celts in Gaul (2500 B.C.)====
By 2500 BC, the Celts immigrated from central Europe to the land that would be known as [[Gaul]], and dominated it until the [[Roman Empire]]'s spread.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[France]]'s entry}}

====Celts in Ireland / The Celts and the Gods (2000 B.C. or 500 B.C.)====
Conflicting tales exist about the Celts' arrival on [[Ireland]]:
* The Milesians' arrival made the [[Tuatha de Danaan]] retreat from Ireland to their realm of [[Otherworld]]. An agreement was made between the Milesian druid [[Amergin Glúingel (Earth-616)|Amergin Glúingel]] and the Tuatha, for the latter to be worshipped by those new inhabitants, in exchange for protection upon the land. The Tuatha honored this deal, and were worshipped by the ancient Celts from about 2000 BC <!-- to 500 AD -->.{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; The [[Tuatha de Danaan]]'s entry}}{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 12}} <!-- 4000 years ago, -->
* The Celts came to reside on Ireland circa 500 BC, at a time battles between the [[Tuatha de Danaan]] and the [[Fomorians|Fomor]] were common. The Fomor's defeat allowed the humans to claim the lands.{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Ireland]]'s entry}}

Around that time, the [[Kree Eternals]] traveled to [[Earth]]. Mistaken for [[Tuatha de Danaan|Gods]] by the Celts, they left, save for 
[[Ard-Con (Earth-616)|Ard-Con]] who lived there for a millennium as the Demon Druid, before being imprisoned by [[Tantalus (Deviant) (Earth-616)|Tantalus]].{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A-Z Update #5|; [[Ard-Con (Earth-616)|Ard-Con]]' entry}}

====Ousting the Picts====
The Celtic [[Gaels (Earth-616)|Gaels]] came from the [[Isles of the West]] to the [[Pictland (Caledonia)|land]] of the [[Picts (Earth-616)|Picts]], whom they drove into the forest and the mountains, though some Picts refused to leave the lands, hiding themselves into caverns, ravines and caves. Many Picts also mingled with the Celts. The Celtic [[Britons (Earth-616)|Britons]] would later come from [[Gallia]] and conquer the Gaels.{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #69|; The Lost Race, Part II}}<!-- Maybe related to: "Another [[Post-Hyborian Cataclysm|cataclysm]] created the [[British Island]] from the mountains of Western Cimmeria and the [[Mediterranean Sea]]. In the west, the remnants of the Picts possessed the lands. [...] In a later age, they would be overthrown by the westward drift of both Cimmerians and Nordics.{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #17|; The Hyborian Age Chapter 6: The Darkness... and the Dawn}}" (Cimmerians and Nordics being Gaels and Britons' ancestors... --><!-- 

"The Nemedians of Irish Legendry were the [[Nemedian Aesir]]".{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #17|; The Hyborian Age Chapter 6: The Darkness... and the Dawn}} -->

...<!-- Cororuc, Berula and the old pict.-->{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #68|; The Lost Race}}{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #69|; The Lost Race, Part II}}

====2nd century B.C.====
Circa the 2nd century B.C., Germanic tribes, including the [[Goths]], the [[Franks]], the [[Teutons]], the [[Suevi]], the [[Cherusci]], the [[Swabians]], the [[Alamani]], and the [[Bavarians]], migrated into an area of northern [[Europe]] that was previously held by the Celts, soon became the dominant culture, and was clashed with the neighboring [[Roman Empire]]. They attacked [[Gaul]] and repelled the advances of the [[Roman Empire]] into the regions east of the [[Rhine]].{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[Germany]]'s entry}}<!-- 

Not a civilization-level event => relevant?
"In circa 150 B.C., [[Morrigan (Earth-616)|The Morrigan]] was once a girl-warrior in Ireland, After the death of her father, she bargained for power from the supernatural and confronted the current Morrigan out of vengeance. The girl-warrior was successful in besting the Morrigan, who lay bleeding out on the ground before the final blow. Before dying, the Morrigan offered her power and position to the girl. The girl seemingly accepted, becoming the next incarnation of the Morrigan for over two thousand years.{{r|X-Factor #244}}" -->

====55 B.C.====
By 55 BC, [[Julius Caesar (Earth-616)|Caesar]]'s first [[Roman]] expedition arrived in Britannia which had became home to various groups of [[Celts]], including the [[Gaels (Earth-616)|Gaels]], [[Scots]] and [[Milenians]] of [[Hibernia]] (future [[Ireland]]), the [[Silures]], and [[Ordovices]] (future [[Wales]]), and the [[Ashrandiar]], [[Catuvellauni]], [[Dumnonii]] and [[Iceni]] (future [[England]]), as well as the [[Picts (Earth-616)|Picts]] and [[Caledonians]] ([[Caledonia]] was the future [[Scotland]]).{{r|Marvel Atlas #1|; [[United Kingdom]]'s entry}}

====200 A.D.====
<!-- Circa 200 AD{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #14|; A Kull Glossary: [[Gonar]]'s entry}}: everything with Bran Brak Mor

 -->...{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #16|; Worms of the Earth}}{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #17|; Worms of the Earth Part 2: Curse of the Black Stone}}

...{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #42|; Kings of the Night}}{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #43|; Kings of the Night Part II: The Pass of Death}}

===[[Christianity]]===
====5th century====
In the [[5th century]], [[Catholicism]] was promoted by [[Saint Patrick (Earth-616)|St. Patrick]] and spread upon the Isles, replacing the Tuatha de Danaan worship, although druid priests and priestesses continued to perform it in secret.<!-- {{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; [[Tuatha de Danaan]]'s entry}} -->

====8th century====
By the [[8th century]], the British Isles were attacked by the [[Vikings]] who plundered the villages. Those attacks also caused the establishment of a cold war between the Tuatha and the [[Asgardians]].{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; [[Tuatha de Danaan]]'s entry}}


Centuries ago, the [[Druids of Rockhenge (Earth-616)|Druids of Rockhenge]] escaped persecution by creating an underwater society off the coast of [[Dublin]] where they lived undisturbed for years.{{r|Sub-Mariner Comics #3}}<!-- 

===[[Modern Age]]===
... -->

==Culture==
===Religion===
The Celts worshiped as gods powerful extradimensional humanoid beings known as the [[Tuatha de Danaan]], who lived on the islands of [[Avalon]] and [[Tír na nÓg]], in a small [[Otherworld|"pocket dimension"]]. These beings helped the form the Celtic civilization.<!-- {{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 12}} -->

The Celts' religious leaders were known as [[Druids]]. They were known to have practiced a form of magic known as [[Druidic Magic]].{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 12}}
